Translation: The woman that woke me up sings well.
The person to whom I gave candies build houses.

Morphemic: ə-nan to ənək-partija-ta nanəpʎepavən jon-at-ɣəjŋ-ə-n mujək-nute-k.
Translation: He and his party fixed life in our land.
Where is the road from Palana toLesnaya?

Comment: correlates with information structure, here (not in the tundra)
both adjectives? Or one modifier is noun?

Translation: I prepared the warm winter clothes.

Morphemic: ŋavət͡ɕŋ-a mik-ə-ne-k ∅-en-aŋja-j mik-ə-ne-k ɣət͡ɕt͡ɕi na-ja-kətʔajŋa-ɣe wutku ∅-ku-jun-et-ə-ŋ-∅.
Translation: The woman who praised me who will scold you lives here.

Morphemic: pit͡ɕɣ-ə-n/ pit͡ɕɣ-e jeq-e t-ewji-k jaq-ə-ŋ ɣə-nan ∅-ineɣej-ə-n t͡ɕoʎt͡ɕoʎ n-ə-mel-qin.
Gloss: Food-EP-ABS.SG/ food-INST what-INST 1SG.S/A-eat-1SG.S what-EP-DAT 2SG-ERG 2/3.S/A.IND-add-EP-3(SG).O salt.ABS.SG ADJ-EP-good-ADJ.SG
Translation: The food that I ate that you added salt to is tasty.

Morphemic: mujək-nəmnəm-ə-k kujunetəŋ ʔujemtewilʔ-ə-n əməŋ mekə-na-ŋ n-ə-ŋotə-qen.
Translation: In our village there lives a person who is angry at everyone (lit. an angry-ateveryone person.)
